headline: PepsiCo India bottler Varun Beverages posts quarterly profit rise on stronger volumes
summary: Feb 3 (Reuters) - India's Varun Beverages reported a higher quarterly profit on Tuesday as higher sales volumes and lower borrowing costs supported margins, sending shares up 4.9% in afternoon trade.

content.title: PepsiCo India bottler Varun Beverages posts quarterly profit rise on stronger volumes
content.summary: Feb 3 (Reuters) - India's Varun Beverages reported a higher quarterly profit on Tuesday as higher sales volumes and lower borrowing costs supported margins, sending shares up 4.9% in afternoon trade.

headline: PepsiCo reports strong Q4 revenue with price hikes offsetting falling demand
summary: PepsiCo reported higher-than-expected revenue in the fourth quarter as higher prices and improved productivity offset continued weakness in North American demand for its snacks and drinks.  Volumes for snacks like Doritos and Cheetos fell 1%, while North American beverage volumes dropped 4%, the Purchase, New York, company said Tuesday.  PepsiCo hiked prices by 4.5% globally during the quarter.

content.title: PepsiCo reports strong Q4 revenue with price hikes offsetting falling demand
content.summary: PepsiCo reported higher-than-expected revenue in the fourth quarter as higher prices and improved productivity offset continued weakness in North American demand for its snacks and drinks.  Volumes for snacks like Doritos and Cheetos fell 1%, while North American beverage volumes dropped 4%, the Purchase, New York, company said Tuesday.  PepsiCo hiked prices by 4.5% globally during the quarter.

headline: PepsiCo tops quarterly revenue estimates on resilient demand for sodas
summary: Feb 3 () - PepsiCo topped fourth-quarter revenue expectations on Tuesday, benefiting from robust demand for its sodas in international ​markets, as well as strength in its low-sugar beverages ‌in the U. Demand for more localized flavors of both snacks and sodas in countries ‌such as India and Brazil boosted sales, even as it overhauls its portfolio in the U.

headline: PepsiCo beats Q4 expectations with revenue growth acceleration
summary: Investing.com -- PepsiCo, Inc. (NASDAQ:PEP) reported fourth-quarter 2025 results that exceeded analyst expectations, with adjusted earnings per share of $2.26, topping the consensus estimate of $2.24 and revenue of $29.34 billion, surpassing the expected $28.98 billion.

content.title: PepsiCo beats Q4 expectations with revenue growth acceleration
content.summary: Investing.com -- PepsiCo, Inc. (NASDAQ:PEP) reported fourth-quarter 2025 results that exceeded analyst expectations, with adjusted earnings per share of $2.26, topping the consensus estimate of $2.24 and revenue of $29.34 billion, surpassing the expected $28.98 billion.

headline: PepsiCo Earnings Beat as It Plans Price Cuts. Why the Stock Is Falling.
summary: PepsiCo  on Tuesday reported earnings ahead of expectations and reiterated its guidance for 2026.  The drinks-and-snacks company posted core earnings per share (EPS) of $2.26 on net revenue of $29.34 billion for the fourth quarter of 2025.  Analysts polled by FactSet had expected PepsiCo to post EPS of $2.24 in on net revenue of $29 billion.

content.title: PepsiCo Earnings Beat as It Plans Price Cuts. Why the Stock Is Falling.
content.summary: PepsiCo  on Tuesday reported earnings ahead of expectations and reiterated its guidance for 2026.  The drinks-and-snacks company posted core earnings per share (EPS) of $2.26 on net revenue of $29.34 billion for the fourth quarter of 2025.  Analysts polled by FactSet had expected PepsiCo to post EPS of $2.24 in on net revenue of $29 billion.

headline: PepsiCo plans price cuts as demand for its drinks and snacks slip
summary: PepsiCo is cutting prices on Lay's, Doritos, Cheetos and Tostitos chips this year to win back customers exasperated by years of price hikes.  PepsiCo has leaned on price increases as the cost of packaging, ingredients and transportation rose, but it's cost the Purchase, New York company in volume.  In the fourth quarter, PepsiCo hiked prices by 4.5% globally.

content.title: PepsiCo plans price cuts as demand for its drinks and snacks slip
content.summary: PepsiCo is cutting prices on Lay's, Doritos, Cheetos and Tostitos chips this year to win back customers exasperated by years of price hikes.  PepsiCo has leaned on price increases as the cost of packaging, ingredients and transportation rose, but it's cost the Purchase, New York company in volume.  In the fourth quarter, PepsiCo hiked prices by 4.5% globally.

headline: These Stocks Are Today’s Movers: Palantir, Teradyne, Tesla, PepsiCo, AMD, NXP Semiconductors, and More
summary: Stock futures were rising Tuesday as strong earnings from Palantir Technologies injected renewed optimism around the artificial-intelligence trade.  Palantir Technologies  jumped 11% in premarket trading after the company, which sells artificial-intelligence software to manage and analyze large amounts of data, reported better-than expected fourth-quarter adjusted earnings.  Revenue jumped 70% from a year earlier to a record $1.41 billion on strong demand for its AI technology.

content.title: These Stocks Are Today’s Movers: Palantir, Teradyne, Tesla, PepsiCo, AMD, NXP Semiconductors, and More
content.summary: Stock futures were rising Tuesday as strong earnings from Palantir Technologies injected renewed optimism around the artificial-intelligence trade.  Palantir Technologies  jumped 11% in premarket trading after the company, which sells artificial-intelligence software to manage and analyze large amounts of data, reported better-than expected fourth-quarter adjusted earnings.  Revenue jumped 70% from a year earlier to a record $1.41 billion on strong demand for its AI technology.

headline: S&P 500, Nasdaq poised for higher open as earnings deluge takes center stage
summary: The S&P 500 and the Nasdaq looked set for a firm open on Tuesday, stabilizing after a commodity rout in the previous session, as investors geared up for ​a flood of corporate results through the week.  Palantir Technologies jumped 11.2% in premarket trading after upbeat results highlighted demand ‌for its military-grade AI tools, with U.S. defense spending helping lift quarterly sales.  "Palantir's good earnings is helpful for the AI trade," said John Campbell, senior portfolio manager, Allspring Global Investments.

content.title: S&P 500, Nasdaq poised for higher open as earnings deluge takes center stage
content.summary: The S&P 500 and the Nasdaq looked set for a firm open on Tuesday, stabilizing after a commodity rout in the previous session, as investors geared up for ​a flood of corporate results through the week.  Palantir Technologies jumped 11.2% in premarket trading after upbeat results highlighted demand ‌for its military-grade AI tools, with U.S. defense spending helping lift quarterly sales.  "Palantir's good earnings is helpful for the AI trade," said John Campbell, senior portfolio manager, Allspring Global Investments.

headline: PepsiCo (NASDAQ:PEP) Exceeds Q4 CY2025 Expectations
summary: Food and beverage company PepsiCo (NASDAQ:PEP) reported Q4 CY2025 results beating Wall Street’s revenue expectations, with sales up 5.6% year on year to $29.34 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $2.26 per share was 1% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: PepsiCo (NASDAQ:PEP) Exceeds Q4 CY2025 Expectations
content.summary: Food and beverage company PepsiCo (NASDAQ:PEP) reported Q4 CY2025 results beating Wall Street’s revenue expectations, with sales up 5.6% year on year to $29.34 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $2.26 per share was 1% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: PepsiCo plans price cuts as demand for its drinks and snacks slips
summary: PepsiCo is cutting prices on Lay's, Doritos, Cheetos and Tostitos chips this year to win back customers exasperated by years of price hikes.  “For some consumers, low- and middle-income consumers, the biggest friction they have today in our category... is affordability,” PepsiCo Chairman and CEO Ramon Laguarta said Tuesday during a conference call with investors.  PepsiCo has leaned on price increases as the cost of packaging, ingredients and transportation rose.

content.title: PepsiCo plans price cuts as demand for its drinks and snacks slips
content.summary: PepsiCo is cutting prices on Lay's, Doritos, Cheetos and Tostitos chips this year to win back customers exasperated by years of price hikes.  “For some consumers, low- and middle-income consumers, the biggest friction they have today in our category... is affordability,” PepsiCo Chairman and CEO Ramon Laguarta said Tuesday during a conference call with investors.  PepsiCo has leaned on price increases as the cost of packaging, ingredients and transportation rose.

headline: PepsiCo Earnings Beat as It Plans Price Cuts. The Stock Is Rising.
summary: PepsiCo  reported earnings that surpassed expectations, but reiterated muted expectations for growth as it plans price cuts.  The drinks-and-snacks company posted core earnings per share of $2.26 on net revenue of $29.34 billion for the fourth quarter of 2025.  Analysts polled by FactSet had expected PepsiCo to post EPS of $2.24 in on net revenue of $29 billion.

content.title: PepsiCo Earnings Beat as It Plans Price Cuts. The Stock Is Rising.
content.summary: PepsiCo  reported earnings that surpassed expectations, but reiterated muted expectations for growth as it plans price cuts.  The drinks-and-snacks company posted core earnings per share of $2.26 on net revenue of $29.34 billion for the fourth quarter of 2025.  Analysts polled by FactSet had expected PepsiCo to post EPS of $2.24 in on net revenue of $29 billion.

headline: Stocks to Watch Tuesday: PayPal, PepsiCo, AMD, Disney
summary: ↘️ Pfizer (PFE): The drugmaker reported lower quarterly sales and swung to a loss, as demand for its Covid-19 vaccine and antiviral drug continued to decline. Shares lost about 4%. ↘️ NXP Semiconductors (NXPI): The Dutch chip maker reported higher quarterly sales and guided for further revenue growth, as management sees rising demand.

headline: Graphic Packaging (GPK) Earnings Transcript
summary: Robert Reebroek: Thank you, Mark.  Before we review our results, I would like to take a few minutes to introduce myself and share my perspective on the opportunities I see for Graphic Packaging.  Over that time, I've held leadership roles at Procter and Gamble, PepsiCo, Kimberly Clark, and Primo Brands where I gained experience operating complex businesses with global manufacturing, and supply chains and building consumer brands at scale.

content.title: Graphic Packaging (GPK) Earnings Transcript
content.summary: Robert Reebroek: Thank you, Mark.  Before we review our results, I would like to take a few minutes to introduce myself and share my perspective on the opportunities I see for Graphic Packaging.  Over that time, I've held leadership roles at Procter and Gamble, PepsiCo, Kimberly Clark, and Primo Brands where I gained experience operating complex businesses with global manufacturing, and supply chains and building consumer brands at scale.
